meanings.definition: Distinctive and stylish elegance or flair.
meanings.sent1: She walked into the room with panache, turning heads with her stylish outfit.
meanings.sent2: The actor performed with panache, capturing the audience's attention with his elegant gestures.
meanings.sent3: With her panache, she made even the simplest dress look like a designer piece.
meanings.sent4: His paintings were filled with panache, each stroke of the brush exuding elegance and flair.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a touch of panache to the dish, garnishing it with colorful edible flowers.

meanings.sent1: The magician entertained the crowd with panache, pulling off tricks with grand flair.
meanings.sent2: Her entrance at the party was full of panache, commanding attention with her flamboyant style.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted across the room with panache, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky with panache, painting it with grand colors and patterns.
meanings.sent5: The marching band performed with panache, their music echoing through the streets with grandeur.

meanings.definition: Confidence and style in one's actions or appearance.
meanings.sent1: He faced the challenge with panache, tackling it with confidence and style.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was delivered with panache, exuding confidence and charm.
meanings.sent3: The catwalk model strutted down the runway with panache, showcasing both confidence and style.
meanings.sent4: The CEO led the meeting with panache, his confident demeanor inspiring the team.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved across the stage with panache, each step radiating confidence and grace.
